meanings.definition: Invertins: enzymes that catalyze the hydrolysis of sucrose into glucose and fructose.
meanings.sent1: The invertins in our bodies help break down sugar into simpler forms.
meanings.sent2: Bakers use invertins to convert sucrose into glucose and fructose for sweet treats.
meanings.sent3: The invertins at the sugar factory were known for their sweet tooth!
meanings.sent4: The invertins worked tirelessly, turning sugar molecules into a dance of glucose and fructose.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, invertins look like tiny sugar-splitting machines.
